entry.title: [lacros] Add additional logging for session debugging
entry.content:
This CL adds further logging to command_storage_backend and some

lacros-specific logging to callsites of LoadTabsFromLastSession().



For affected users, session reads are triggered for both tab

and session restore when the lacros process is first started in

windowless mode. This does not occur for unaffected users.

Understanding what specifically is tripping this code path should

help in root causing the restore failures.



Logs in the command_storage_backend will give better insight into

how session files are being handled. Logs in code calling

TabRestoreService::LoadTabsFromLastSession() will help to understand

if this is being run at unexpected times during startup, potentially

influencing the resulting restore state.



Lacros specific overrides to the VLOG level at these callsites

have been added to avoid users needing to run the latest version

of both ash and lacros for the logs to begin appearing in user logs.



Bug: 1424800, 1450427

Change-Id: I365590f8665d02b3619fc7bf6e5ec582b88a0ac9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577089

Commit-Queue: Thomas Lukaszewicz

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1152340}

entry.title: PRESUBMIT.py: remove `USE_PYTHON3 = True`
entry.content:
presubmit now uses python3 only.



This is generated by

$ rg -l '^USE_PYTHON3 = True' | \

xargs sed -z -i "s/ *USE_PYTHON3 = True */ /"

with some more modifications.



This also removes run_on_python2, run_on_python3, and skip_shebang_check

args.

On Chrome OS, energy metrics collection works the same way as on Linux, which also gets data from perf event and requires '/proc/sys/kernel/perf_event_paranoid' set to 0.

Modifying the paranoid's value needs sudo permission, so it requires developer mode to use SystemPowerMonitor on Chrome OS.

entry.title: Notify observers when FullScreenHtmlApiHandler exits full screen.
entry.content:
This change updates the FullScreenHtmlApiHandler onExitFullscreen method to notify observers when we exit full screen through calls to exitPersistentFullscreenMode.



Initially this started as an investigation for why full screen pip

would try to render the entire site when the device is locked/unlocked.



The actual problem here is that when the activity stops, the

FullScreenHtmlApiHandler calls exitPersistentFullscreenMode(),

which sets mPersistentModeSupplier to false. As a result, when we

finally call onExitFullScreen, observers are not notified since

wasInPersistentFullscreenMode is already set to false.



Bug: 1443087

Change-Id: I34305a3fa50c7eb80267064bed23477dad2f649b

entry.title: Fix a bunch of invalid uses of StringPiece::data()
entry.content:
A StringPiece is a pointer/length pair and not guaranteed to be

NUL-terminated. Passing .data() into a function that expects a

NUL-terminated const char * is invalid and will go out-of-bounds

(security bug) if the StringPiece didn't happen to created from a

NUL-terminated value.



Fortunately, most StringPieces are created from buffers that happen to

be NUL-terminated, but we cannot safely rely on this. This fixes a

bunch of instances I found looking through code search, most of it in

ash. Some observations:



- Some code converts StringPiece to string by calling .data(). This is

unnecessary because there is already a conversion defined.



- StringPrintf does not work well with StringPiece. I converted to

string or used StrCat.



- When functions take const std::string& and the caller has a

StringPiece, it is a common mistake to call .data(). This is

incorrect, but. To reduce the risk of people making that mistake

again, I converted a few functions to StringPiece where it was easy.



Change-Id: I9978c11adbc6f36acf0401e765e4495bdbe8c470

entry.title: Rename LayoutBox::CanBeProgrammaticallyScrolled to IsUserScrollable
entry.content:
The original name was bad because it didn't return true for a

LayoutBox with overflow:hidden with overflow.



It had two callers:

1. MouseEventManager::HandleMousePressEvent(),

2. LayoutBox::CanBeScrolledAndHasScrollableArea() which had several

callers.



The original function was like:

return IsScrollContainer() && (HasScrollableOverflow() ||

IsDocumentNode() ||

HasEditableStyle());

while CanBeSrolledAndHasScrollableArea() was like:

return CanBeProgrammaticallyScrolled() && HasScrollableOverflow();

which was equivalent to

return HasScrollableOverflow();



So CanBeProgrammaticallyScrolled and CanBeScrolledAndHasScrollableArea

are combined into IsUserScrollable.



Potential behavior changes are:

1. For caller #1 about non-scrollable document or editable nodes

(the function previously returned true, now returns false),

but the caller doesn't seem to want the non-scrollable nodes [1].

2. For callers #2 about overflow:hidden on or with

overflow (the function previously returned true, now returns

false), but all callers (except for IntersectionObservation [2])

seem to want user-scrollable scrollers only.



[1] The editable case was added in https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/be62a516f9687d1d1b28248bb03f736eafe5498c%5E%21/

(thanks to szager@ for tracking to it) to support autoscroll

in overflow:hidden editable elements. However, I tried such a

case in Chrome, Firefox and Safari, and autoscroll (on selection)

only works in Safari. Middle click autoscroll also doesn't work

in Chrome and Firefox. Scroll on caret move is not affected by

this CL.



[2] IntersectionObservation::CanUseCachedRects() ignores normal

overflow:hidden scroll containers, but treated overflow:hidden

view as scrollable. This CL makes LayoutView behaves the same as

normal scrollers for IntersectionObservation. This will be fixed

in a followup.



Change-Id: Iff063513a695ac9c2c76a755f53fd6d6a77abe17

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4568249

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1152296}

entry.title: Fetch: Support BYOB reading for Response.body
entry.content:
ReadableByteStream is a variant of ReadableStream specialized for

bytes[1]. Given the performance benefits, this CL adds BYOB support

for Fetch by making Response.body a byte stream to allow for reading

with a bring-your-own-buffer(BYOB) reader.



The corresponding spec PR for this was landed at https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/pull/1593.



[1] https://streams.spec.whatwg.org/#readable-byte-stream



Low-Coverage-Reason: Behavior changes are covered by WPTs (i.e. response-consume-stream.any.js and Blob-stream.any.js).

entry.title: [Foldables] Hide activity tab when the activity is hidden during
entry.content:
activity recreation



Currently, the activity tab is hidden when the activity is hidden during

activity recreation only when tab reparenting is not in progress;

unfolding a device triggers tab reparenting before

ChromeActivity#onActivityHidden is invoked so the activity tab is not

essentially hidden at this time. After the activity is recreated in this

case, a call to ChromeActivity#onActivityShown is unable to invoke

Tab#show as expected because the tab is not hidden in the first place.

It is therefore necessary for Tab#hide to be invoked at the correct time

in this process to render the web contents / show the tab correctly.



This CL adds an alternate check on

AsyncTabParamsManager#hasParamsForTabId to hide the tab in

ChromeActivity#onActivityHidden in the event that tab reparenting is

already in progress.



Bug: 1432051

Change-Id: I38dadbef15818768cd54f6a76bfc6fb155ee2c25

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4582990

entry.title: Adds Browser::is_delete_scheduled and fixes some usage
entry.content:
When the last tab is removed from a browser the window is closed, a

post task is scheduled, and when the post task runs the Browser is

deleted. This can not be undone.



The current code assumes no WebContents will be added between the

time the tabstrip is empty and the time the browser is deleted.

Unfortunately, because of the delay, it is possible for a WebContents

to be inserted and bad things to happen.



We could make Browser delete any remaining WebContents, but this

is problematic for two reasons:

1. Code adding the WebContents is likely assuming the Browser is

visible.

2. The WebContents may have unload handlers, which can not be handled

synchronously.



Because of this, we should explicitly disallow (CHECK) if a

WebContents is added to a Browser about to be deleted.



This patch adds a member to Browser so that you can tell if it is

about to be deleted, fixes some places that were adding WebContents,

and adds a DumpWithoutCrashing() to help identify problematic

places. The goal is to convert DumpWithoutCrashing() to a CHECK.



Bug: 1434387





Change-Id: Iabfebc8705859144cf430b06cd032b26a28e0abd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4577858

entry.content:
Handles the case where the tabs of a group change before session restore

takes place. This can happen in scenarios where the browser crashes, and

a user opens a group, modifies it, closes it, then clicks the restore

button.

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Copy baselines for physical-under-virtual tests
entry.content:
Physical tests under virtual directories generate malformed optimization

graphs because different parts of the copier did not agree whether such

tests are virtual. To be consistent, ensure these tests are not virtual

for the purposes of optimization by checking for the existence of a test

file.



The optimizer is internally consistent, but add test coverage for it as

well.

entry.title: [Files]: Fixes the race between getMetadata and end of scanning.
entry.content:
When search uses modified timestamp we filter entries based on the

modificationTime attribute in their metadata. This however is available

in a callback only. It is possible for readEntriesRecursively to end the

scan before metadata is received. In the original solution that meant an

immediate call to the resolve callback with entries collected so far.

Even if more entries were waiting to be added via the metadata callback.

In this solution we use workLeft to count how many callbacks we need to

receive before we can make a call to resolve. We start with 1, which is

the callback from readEntriesRecursively. Every time we schedule

metadata callback we add to workLeft. Every time we process metadata we

subtract from workLeft. To allow for parallel execution of multiple

getMetadata calls we use Promise.all to wait for them all.



Bug: b:273855280

Change-Id: I2d9a4f4542c84dcf7a7231854010f6ab4d5f20a2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4570341

entry.title: [Webview] Avoid old Android IPC used to check for key system support
entry.content:
Previously each renderer on Android would check for key system support

by using cdm::QueryKeySystemSupport(), which uses the old IPC protocol.

New way is to use the KeySystemSupport mojo interface where key

systems are registered in the browser, and renderers subscribe to

notifications. This matches what is being done for desktop browsers

(and Chrome on Android).



KeySystemSupport allows for delayed determination of what features are

supported until the first time it is queried. So registration in the

browser is done without specifying any capabilities, and they will be

computed the first time they are needed.



This also moves AddOtherAndroidKeySystems() into a separate file so

that it can be reused for this change.



Tested using WebView Browser Tester and playing videos from Widevine's

integration site on a Pixel 4 and again on an Android emulator.



Bug: 853336

Test: see above

Change-Id: Ida12361fa8367f9644287d4ef95eb6a723034ab7

entry.title: Fix DCHECK when there is already a pending xr session request
entry.content:
It is possible to racily force two session requests to get served to the

same runtime. This results in a DCHECK because we expect to only have

one outstanding request at a time. For now, this softens the DCHECK into

simply an immediate reject, but future work will investigate

strengthening the guarantees from the Browser process that we cannot

get multiple session requests.



Fixed: 1450601

entry.title: Don't set show_state to MAXIMIZED when getting last active window state on Mac.
entry.content:
This is consistent with GetPersistentState which on Mac will

never return MAXIMIZED either, since NativeWidgetMac::GetWindowPlacement

never returns a maximized state. Maximized (on Mac called "Zoomed") is

merely determined by the window size; GetRestoredBounds returns the

maximized bounds for a window on Mac, so behavior is the same (for

regular browser windows) regardless of if show_state is returned as

default or maximized. For PWA windows (i.e. out of process

remote-cocoa windows) creating a window as maximized results in the

window not being visible for some reason, so not doing so is strictly

better there.



Bug: 1441966

Change-Id: I2d704fe1a87575bc012bcccd48afa16e5c5ba6e1

entry.title: Bubbles should inherit the same color provider as the browser window.
entry.content:
Currently, because things like menus, etc. can have their own color

providers, a bubble attached to a menu can inherit a different color

provider from other help bubbles.



This change makes bubbles by default inherit the color provider from

their primary window, using the current behavior as a fallback. This

will make colors in bubbles more consistent, even when windows aren't

parented consistently.



See attached bug for a case where this currently breaks.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Remove AccessibilityManager dependency from WebContentsAccessibilityImpl
entry.content:
This CL continues the AccessibilityState consolidation work for Clank.



With this CL we remove the hard dependency on AccessibilityManager that

the WebContentsAccessibilityImpl class has. We will instead use the new

AccessibilityState class directly. We also remove the corresponding

*ForTesting method and make callers of it use AccessibilityState as

well. This is cleaner as the web contents should not be used to control

the state of accessibility of the entire app.

entry.title: Multiplanar: Plumb color space through D3D11TextureWrapper
entry.content:
This change plumbs the video frame color space to D3D11TextureWrapper

where it is used for creating a shared image. This is needed for

multiplanar shared images where the color space within the shared image

is used to create skia images and then perform a YUV to RGB conversion

within RasterDecoder through a skia blit instead of earlier plumbing

the video frame color space to perform conversion through another

method.



Here, the color space is passed from the D3D11 video decoder which

also clears the picture buffers, recreating pictures and shared images

on a color space change trigger. The color space is then passed through

the texture selector to wrapper where it is stored and used for

creating shared images later.



Bug: 1444189

Change-Id: Ic69bb2adfce99ef974b80d25b4937a38db7d898d

entry.title: [Performance Settings] Reverse order of exception list
entry.content:
Display rules in the exception list with the most recently added shown

first. This only affects how the exception list is displayed, and the

underlying list pref will still have the most recently added rules

appended to the end.



Prior to this, the exception list overflow would be expanded any time

that a rule was added, so that the newly added rules would be visible

after the add dialog closes. Now that they are added to the top, the

overflow will no longer expand when adding rules.

entry.title: MP4 muxer - moof box and its children, and mdat box.
entry.content:
It adds moof box and its children of mfhd, traf, tfhd,

hfdt, trun, and mdat box.



1. It uses default-base-is-moof that is a enforced flag from

web isobmff, which leads to deletion of moof offset set/get

APIs from the context.



2. It also uses BoxByteStream for mdat offset, which leads

to deletion of mdat offset set/get APIs from the context.



3. It adds WriteAndFlush API to Mp4BoxWriter that accept

BoxByteStream as a parameter to support multiple root boxes

write with single BoxByteStream object. It is required

for 'trun' box's data_offset refer to another root box

of 'mdat' box.



4. It remove WriteU24 API from the BoxByteStream because

it is only used once, and the current implementation does

not support big endian format. Removing and write U32 with

bit operations seems more efficient than wrting big endian

format (WriteBigEndian).



5. This CL is the last of box writer.



Bug: 1072056

Change-Id: I90dd7c1c3fbcd3a9fa9b5d869bf9550122465e26

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4575451

entry.title: Signal that there was no user-visible authentication (1/4)
entry.content:
This CL adds the logic to signal to FormDataImporter that there was no

user-visible authentication when a local card is autofilled directly,

or a VCN goes through a green path autofill flow. This will be used

later to only trigger the Mandatory re-auth opt-in bubble when there was

a flow with no user-visible authentication to autofill a card, and the

form was submitted.



This CL also adds logic to reset the bool variable in FormDataImporter

if we land on a new form, to ensure that previous no-user visible

authentications do not affect functionality in future forms.



Bug: 1427216

entry.title: Invalidate `WeakPtr<ExtensionService>` in `ExtensionService::Shutdown`.
entry.content:
As documented in `//components/keyed_service/core/keyed_service.h` keyed

services are supposed to drop all their references during the first

phase of the shutdown. Even though `ExtensionService` is not itself a

`KeyedService`, it should still follow this advice (because it is owned

by a `KeyedService` and shouldn't be used once the profile starts

shutting down). `WeakPtr`s are a form of a reference and therefore it

seems desirable to invalidate them from `ExtensionService::Shutdown`.



Bug: 1449814

Change-Id: I24e18ae0ff0322366e36fb6c55f85be70d14d093

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4581148

entry.title: Introduce MismatchingEntryDeletionTask
entry.content:
This CL introduces MismatchingEntryDeletionTask in

SharedDictionaryManagerOnDisk. This task resolve the mismatch between

the disk cache and metadata database. The mismatch can be happen when

network service process crashes while writing the dictionary. This task

is a relatively heavy task because it needs to retrieve all disk cache

key token. So this task is executed only once in the lifetime of the

NetworkContext when ClearData() is called.

entry.title: [SPEAK-ON-MUTE] Merge speak-on-mute flag into VC.
entry.content:
With the newly added UI, speak on mute detection needs to be a VC only

feature. Thus, it is meaningless to have an extra flag for this feature.
